ETYMOLOGY: From Old French galaxie, from Latin galaxias, from Ancient Greek γαλαξίας (galaxías, 'Milky Way'), from γάλα (gála, 'milk').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A massive system of stars, stellar remnants, interstellar gas, dust, and dark matter, all bound gravitationally.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 由恒星、恒星遗迹、星际气体、尘埃和暗物质等通过引力结合在一起的巨大系统。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Our solar system is part of the Milky Way galaxy.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们的太阳系是银河系的一部分。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A brilliant or impressive assemblage of persons or things, especially famous or talented ones.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 杰出人物或事物的辉煌或令人印象深刻的集合。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The film premiere attracted a galaxy of stars and celebrities.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这部电影的首映式吸引了一大批明星和名人。

REGISTER: General language for the first meaning; slightly formal or literary for the second meaning.
